tv.generator-info-name: Original XML Generated with Tempest EPG Generator (made by Kvanc) - Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v0.9

programme.title: rage _(?)_/ Special
programme.desc: From Pussy Riot to Fall Out Boy, Turnstile, Ecca Vandal and more, join us as we try to play as many different songs as quickly possible in our rage _(?)_/ Special

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Thomas Oriti present an engaging mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Geelong will face Brisbane in the AFL Grand Final. Abbey Gelmi and the panel Laura Spurway, Waleed Aly and Ryan Hoffman discuss the AFL Preliminary Finals, the NRL Semis and Gout Gouts World Athletic Championships campaign.

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: A new secular religion is sweeping urban Sydney. Bringing together many who feel marginalised or rejected by mainstream religion, Creation is a queer science fiction climate change religion. With guest presenter Benjamin Law.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Animal Attraction: Gardens for Bees and Birds
programme.desc: Costa finds out how to choose a chook breed, Sophie plants for buzz pollinators, Jerry has tips for living with possums, Millie explores a backyard wildlife corridor, and we meet an ornithologist tracking wedge-tailed eagles.

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Andrew Simpson and Krysty Peebles are building their home next to Andrews father and his partners property. Andrews determined to build to the highest environmental standards and get a gorgeous house on a budget as well.

programme.title: Mystery Road: Origin
programme.desc: A new posting to the town of Loch Iris, and Jay Swans hopes of a new beginning with Mary are shattered when hes nearly sideswiped by a stolen car, the suspicious death of an elderly nun and a missing child.

programme.title: rage Vault: RnB 1997
programme.desc: rage digs into the vault to bring you the best RnB deep-cuts, hits and ear worms from the year 1997.

programme.title: The Art Of Being Funny
programme.desc: Namila Benson faces her greatest fear... stand-up comedy! Namila chats with comedian Shaun Micallef, comic Zainab Johnson, classicist Mary Beard, father/son duo Dane and Bow Simpson and political satirist Badiucao.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of a Psychic Fayre, Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to find the killer. (Final)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Natalie and Stuart promise to save the soul of their "fixer-upper", but face obstacles with eccentric renovations that risk upsetting the old owners.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Jeremy Fernandez, plus weather with Tom Saunders.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: When a charismatic sports teacher arrived at Sarah Kopps school, the talented students life was upended. When she finally sought justice, she faced a near-impossible choice.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Australias leading forum for media analysis and comment. Host Linton Besser, a four-time Walkley award-winning investigative reporter and former foreign correspondent, brings you a fearless critique of the weeks journalism.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the days events, explaining whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.desc: After a friendly Mario 64 competition turns Screen Goblin into a full-blown gamer rage monster, Gem and Harry must venture far from the den of gaming in search of anything to calm him down!

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Harold concocts an anti-aging cream for Chef but when it turns the kids old Chef hides the reversal cream because taking care of old people is making him young again!

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Without Ladybug and Cat Noir knowing, Shadow Moth patiently sets his final attack in motion...

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: In this two part episode, Odd Squad agents compete in Olympic style games to determine who gets to be Ms. O for the day.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer cant find his buried bone. Its up to Shaun and the flock to try and find it, but X doesnt always mark the spot.

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: Ava asks Janine to help her teach the after-school step class, but they dont agree on how to run the program.

programme.title: Merlin
programme.desc: Morgana uses Gwen to lure Arthur into a deadly trap.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Britains strongest woman, Andrea Thompson, joins the doctors in the lab as they reveal how muscle fibres work, and we say hello to 3 more incredible Ouch Award finalists.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Chloe, a child prodigy Chloe finds it difficult to connect with her much older classmates. The Bears take her under their wing, showing her how to make great college friends.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: A student named Marc gets akumatized into Reverser. Convinced that Marinette and Nathaniel made a fool of him, hes determined to get revenge. Will Ladybug and Cat Noir manage to reverse the situation?

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Vanishing Koalas
programme.desc: Kakow Koalas are the latest snack sensation sweeping the playground and Mario is hungry for justice when his are stolen.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer has a terrible toothache, so Shaun turns dentist in an attempt to cure his woes.

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides everyday adventurers hoping to make it to the Crystal Dome. Will a team comprised of people paid to play computer games for a living be able to nerd their way to victory?

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Gotta Go Fast, The Sonic Special!
programme.desc: Gems joined by Sonic expert Bajo for a super speedy Sonic episode! Plus, SG sings about Sonics greatest superpower, another date goes astray in Finding Player 2 and Gem and Harry get a surprise in The New Coach!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Newsflash just in... a super gross stink has been detected coming from the vicinity of the Doctors lab. The hunt is on for grossest thing on Operation Ouch!...ever!

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Regulars Sandi Toksvig and Alan Davies are joined by guests Noel Fielding, Joe Lycett and Hannah Gadsby to discuss Pictures.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Property expert Phil Spencer visits Wakefield to help the Murphy family sell their higgledy-piggledy, end-of-terrace home in a hurry so they can start a new life in Perth, Australia.

programme.title: Silverpoint
programme.desc: Kaz is still missing and the rest of Dragonfly feel uneasy about leaving the camp without her. Fisher has a proposal for Louis - but can he be trusted?Â

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: The Nektons try to stop a fallen satellites fuel from polluting a marine sanctuary. But someone else is interested in the satellite: Alpheus Benthos, who is intent on finding Lemuria before them!

programme.title: Ninjago Dragons Rising
programme.desc: Lloyd, Arin and Sora travel return Riyu to his clan and discover a strange, new power to confront the dragon hunters who follow them.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic: Princess Twilight Sparkle
programme.desc: Synopsis

programme.title: Miraculous World: New York, United Heroez
programme.desc: During a school field trip, Ladybug and Cat Noir meet the American superheroes, whom they have to save from an akumatised super-villain. They discover that Miraculous exist in the United States too.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Pane In The Glass, Onions And You
programme.desc: The MythBusters take on an incredibly dangerous, glass shattering movie myth and then put themselves and six volunteers through the rigours of finding a cure for "onion tears".

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Censor-in-chief? Trumps warning to TV networks after Kimmel is pulled off air. Was it a drone, meteor or UFO? We talk mystery sightings and the search for extraterrestrial life. Plus cracks in the mental health system.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: The 15th and final season of ER begins with the devastating repercussions of the ambulance explosion. As Morris and Neela do everything they can to save a wounded colleague, Abby treats a young girl injured during the blast.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: In the Heights
programme.desc: In the Heights fuses Lin-Manuel Mirandas kinetic music and lyrics with director Jon M. Chus lively and authentic eye for storytelling to capture a world very much of its place, but universal in its experience.

programme.title: Silverpoint
programme.desc: Having made it to the facility and discovered even more about the mysterious Artefact, a reunited Dragonfly seek out the truth of what lies behind the red door.Â Â Â

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Is the Baltic Sea Anomaly really a UFO that crashed into the ocean 600 years ago? Ant thinks it is. But what the Nektons find inside is even more strange and frightening.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Suspect Sprinkler
programme.desc: When the timer on Mrs Maniacis sprinkler system is tampered with before the Garden of the Year; competition, the Inbestigators must track down the culprit.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: With their cutie marks finally acquired, the Cutie Mark Crusaders struggle with the question of what to do now. Apple Bloom suggests they embrace their destinies, but she and her friends dont exactly agree on how.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: There are so many clubs for Numberblocks to belong to - its time for Twenty-Nine to figure out where he belongs! Learn about grouping numbers by numerical properties with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and the kids explore a tropical fruit farm and learn about how they grow, how to pick them and then feast on fruits theyve never tried before.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily
programme.desc: Halves and quarters, counting in halves and quarters, doubling numbers, halving numbers.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Its an undercover operation of the Welsh-valley variety for Agent Spencer as he finds himself in Llanharan, Pontyclun, with a house for sale thats in need of a re-vamp.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: The Mythbusters hook into the decidedly fishy tale of a Killer Carp-tastrophe; can a leaping two-pound fish land a killer blow on a hapless water skier?

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Pontipines are riding on the Ninky Nonk but Mr and Mrs Pontipine cant find the children.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The sounds in a Wildlife Park are extreme, which gives the Sound Collector a noisy idea!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Its snack time for Bing but the only banana left is too mushy to eat. Flop suggests making a smoothie with it instead.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George is making bubbles and Peppa is popping them. When the bubble mixture runs out, Daddy Pig shows them how to make really big bubbles then makes a big, muddy, bubbly puddle for everyone to play in.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its the night before Halloween and Bitzer is charged with guarding the Farmers 3 prize pumpkins. Despite Shaun and the flocks best efforts, the pumpkins mysteriously disappear, leaving nothing but a trail of ghostly slime.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Naughty Gaston is sent to pet school, where Miss Jolly soon gets him into shape.

programme.title: Ariel
programme.desc: Ariel uses magic to clean her room. Ariel befriends a clam.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters reimagine Alice in Wonderland with fresh adventures, crafting a magical stage play that celebrates creativity, teamwork, and imagination.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds discover some of the clever things that happen on railways! Two passenger trains become one in a faraway railway station, and then they see how freight trains move giant boxes all around the country!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman is playing Superheroes with James - Norman is Norman-Man and James is his sidekick Atomic Boy. Suddenly Lion the cat floats off in a boat and James and Norman find they have a real rescue on their hands.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: Spin finds his favourite socks under his bed, but theyre too small for him. The Mixmups mix up an adventure to find a way to grow them big again.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Join Evie Wiggle as she writes a poem! With each Wiggle asking for her help to remember something, Evie makes a helpful poem, showing that inspiration can come from anywhere!

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: The Numberblocks have to do some clever counting to cross a sticky swamp.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Charlotte Sheep is babysitting her cousin Suzy Sheep and her best friend Peppa. Peppa and Suzy are excited at their sleepover and sit up in bed talking about what they will do when they are all grown up.

programme.title: Lu And The Bally Bunch
programme.desc: Declan causes a stir when he decides not to say please.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish and Bobby go into Rosas art studio, even though they arent meant to go in there without her. Tish then, accidently, knocks ink all over Rosas latest picture.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When Zigzags ADHD gives her a case of the hops, Vida teaches her how to make a to-do list.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Benjamin and Hettie find an old treasure map that leads to Blue Whiskers Pirate Shipwreck! They ask Stanley to help them find it using his submarine, and maybe bring it back as an exhibit for everyone to enjoy.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Determined to perform a magic trick, Connor finds an ancient teleporting sarcophagus that make things disappear.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: A celebrity quokka visits Kangaroo Beach to film an episode of the smash hit TV series Wallaby Waters.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas finds out that the Earls Technology Fair will bring new inventions to Sodor, he sets out to prove that steam engines are the best inventions ever.

programme.title: Wilfrid Gordon Mcdonald Partridge
programme.desc: When 6-year-old Wilfrid discovers his 96-year-old best friend Nancy has lost her memory, he embarks on a heartwarming quest to help her remember. Based on the classic childrens book by Mem Fox.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: When Orla breaks up the band Soundcheck, the Mobile Unit team must convince the band members to reunite. On top of that, the Mobile Unit must make sure a villainous rival band doesnt hypnotise people with their music.

programme.title: Little J And Big Cuz
programme.desc: The kids are baffled when precious things go missing so detectives Little J and Levi search for clues. Big Cuz knows one piece of the puzzle - overwhelmed by receiving her pen licence, shes hidden her pen.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its snowing and Grampy Rabbit has built a jetpack. He shoots off into the distance ending up on top of a snowy mountain. Miss Rabbit goes to rescue him, but Grampy Rabbit is the one that rescues them all.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Catboy and Bastet rivalry and egos causes them to fall for Pharaoh boys plan.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: The town hall is leaking and needs a new roof and Paddington must stay silent to raise the money. Will Mr Brown really shave off all his hair for charity?

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.sub-title: Upsy Daisy Dances With Pinky Ponk
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy shows her love for everything in the garden by dancing.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector discovers a bee in the garden. But how will he get it flying again?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing finds a frog in the garden and wants to keep it so he and Sula make the frog a house in a bucket. But froggy doesnt like her new home and hops out.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Theres a new pupil, Emily Elephant. Everyone wants to be her friend because shes good at building blocks and makes a very loud noise with her trunk. Peppa and Emily have something in common: they both like muddy puddles.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its breakfast time and the Farmer discovers he has no fresh milk for his morning cup of tea. He sets off in great haste but Shaun and the Flock are too impatient to wait for breakfast and take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: As Norman leaves the house, the giant hat he made for the Pontypandy Hat Parade gets stuck in the door, just as the sitting room goes up in flames!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Snooty King and Queen Marigold are coming to visit, but when the Kings new clothes get dirty Nanny cleans them and accidentally shrinks them all.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: At Playgroup, Madame Gazelle talks to the children about hobbies. The children share what they and their parents like to do for fun but everyone knows Peppas hobby is jumping in muddy puddles!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemmas obsession with a pair of passing whales distracts her from her duties. Meanwhile, one of the whales does some wombat watching and becomes beached.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Lobo and Spike learn the power of teamwork and embracing uniqueness in magical adventures filled with lessons on friendship and overcoming challenges.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley, Sophie and Benjamin make a Dino-Pirate float for the carnival.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie goes to the cinema with Akil and Nina, learning to enjoy himself even when it gets a little noisy.

programme.title: Play School Story Time
programme.sub-title: Hamish Blake: Where Is The Green Sheep?
programme.desc: Have you seen the green sheep? Join the search as Hamish Blake and Play Schools Scrap read Where Is The Green Sheep, by Mem Fox and illustrated by Judy Horacek, meeting all sorts of sheep along the way!

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Its snowing! The Alphablocks whip up a wondrous winter wonderland, but can they get Mr Snowman to the North Pole in time? This episode has fun with the words man, fun, sun, fan, tan, van and men.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its snowing and Grampy Rabbit has built a jetpack. He shoots off into the distance ending up on top of a snowy mountain. Miss Rabbit goes to rescue him, but Grampy Rabbit is the one that rescues them all.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When a young Cornasaurolophus strays from its herd and befriends Ginger and the Peas, all is fine until it starts popping which draws attention of the Bananaraptors!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When Tidbit gets a mosquito bite on picture day, he doesnt want a photo... until Vida has an idea!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Fifi asks Stanley to help her find a new place for her friend Isabelle the Sun-bell Daisy. This proves trickier than initially planned as Isabelle has some specific needs.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekko is forced to be a sneaky crocodile instead of a loyal lizard because Pharaoh Boy has taken his friends prisoner.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemmas obsession with a pair of passing whales distracts her from her duties. Meanwhile, one of the whales does some wombat watching and becomes beached.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Bulgy thinks that people should travel by bus instead of rail until he learns that having so many passengers is not so easy for the buses on their own.

programme.title: Reef School
programme.desc: When Oli the octopus discovers the coral is turning white, Chips the pufferfishs Nan tells the Reefies a special story about the beautiful colours of the reef back in the olden days.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Caterina, John and Captain take turns trying to cheer up Tsehay as she is feeling a little sad today. Sing and learn with Tsehay, count with John and laugh with Simon in Pull a Funny Face.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: The Mechas need to act quickly when the snowman scarecrow that Zee made for MacBarm keeps blowing away!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo and Lila are excited to play on their new waterslide.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig arrives in a new electric car. The family all go for a ride and are surprised when the car talks and sings!

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Mojo is go-go in the snow with Tao as they snowboard together, if Mojo doesnt freeze up!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Kwazii takes Tracker to the desert for his final test to become an Octo-Agent but they get lost while helping a young golden mole. To survive, they must do as the desert creatures do and find water.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: During a friendly game of neighbourhood cricket, the dads struggle to bowl Rusty out.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog and the squirrels decide to play hide and seek and Duggee finds them all except Roly.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The Cobs try to capture Supertato while Evil Pea is on holiday, but it goes wrong resulting in Evil Pea getting covered in flour and custard over in the bath products aisle.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo and Bluey have five minutes to bed, just enough time to race to the summit of Mount Mumandad! But facing powerful storms, avalanches and stinky spots, this will take teamwork.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Trouble in paradise: Tensions after Pacific journalists were excluded from the PMs presser. A US podcast outfit with truly a podcast for everyone. Plus Taliban tourism: influencers give Afghanistan an Instagram glow-up.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: Lessons learned from drought on King Island; and understanding the reasons some rural Victorians feel unfairly treated.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.sub-title: Charlie Kirk and Trumps divided America
programme.desc: In the week following the death of right wing commentator Charlie Kirk there have been plenty of claims and conspiracy theories. Julia Baird and guest host Chas Licciardello wonder if America is now more divided than ever.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Businesses suffer as the search for an alleged killer hits tourism hard, the fight to save some of the countrys purest honey from a deadly bee parasite, and meet the man who paid $66,000 for a tray of mangoes.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers is in New York for the UN General Assembly, joined by Laura Tingle. In studio Melissa Clarke and the panel of Katina Curtis, Peter Hartcher and Jennifer Hewett discuss the week including climate targets and PNG.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Ruby Cornish presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Ruby Cornish.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: The billion dollar superannuation nightmare: retirement in tatters for thousands after the collapse of First Guardian and Shield. Plus why Labor says hitting the new emissions target is a golden opportunity.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: Imitating the effects of lightning to supercharge plant growth; Tasmanias farmers learning to cope with a more volatile climate; and one mans vision to solve the power problems of a small Western Australian town.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers is in New York for the UN General Assembly, joined by Laura Tingle. In studio Melissa Clarke and the panel of Katina Curtis, Peter Hartcher and Jennifer Hewett discuss the week including climate targets and PNG.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: Mallorca is a hotspot for the prostitution business in Spain, where most women in the industry are victims of traffickers. In Britain, Gen Z is reviving singing sea shanties. Plus Sardinia is the island of centenarians.

programme.title: Tech Smart Agriculture
programme.desc: Fruit flies are one of Australias most destructive and costly pests. But a new high-tech trap using the same technology as the fingerprint ID on a smartphone, promises to reduce chemical use.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and top stories, joined by Catherine Murphy with sport and Nate Byrne with weather.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Kathryn Robinson brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to cover whats happening and why it matters. Kathryn Robinson brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Johnson Raela presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Chas and John cover a monumental week in global affairs as world leaders descend on New York for the UN General Assembly, with Palestinian statehood and wars in Gaza and Ukraine high on the agenda.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.
